system
in package
  • Application

system.php : 7

The system class handles core system-level functionality, such as authentication, caching, and redirection within the application.

beAdmin()

system.php : 51

Ensures the user is an administrator.

public beAdmin() : bool

If the user is not authenticated, they are redirected to the login page. If the user is not an admin, a 403 Forbidden header is returned.

Return values
bool —

True if the user is an admin, false otherwise.

beAuthenticated()

system.php : 36

Ensures the user is authenticated.

public beAuthenticated() : mixed

If the user is not authenticated, they are redirected to the login page.

cache()

system.php : 72

Caches data in Redis with a specified time-to-live (TTL).

public cache(string $input, mixed $data[, int $ttl = 60 ]) : mixed
Parameters
$input : string

The key for the cache entry.

$data : mixed

The data to be cached.

$ttl : int = 60

Time-to-live for the cache entry in seconds. Default is 60 seconds.

cache_get()

system.php : 89

Retrieves cached data from Redis.

public cache_get(string $query) : mixed
Parameters
$query : string

The key for the cache entry.

Return values
mixed —

The cached data, or null if the data is not found.

checkCache()

system.php : 108

Checks if a specific entry exists in the local cache array.

public checkCache(string $input) : mixed
Parameters
$input : string

The key to check in the local cache.

Return values
mixed —

The cached data if it exists, or false if not found.

public redirect(string $location) : mixed
Parameters
